kw.name: Set Suite Variable
kw.doc: Makes a variable available everywhere within the scope of the current suite.

kw.name: Start Consumer Threaded
kw.doc: Run consumer in daemon thread and store data from topics. To read and work with this collected data use keyword `Get Messages From Thread`. Could be used at the Test setup or in each test. This is useful when you are reading always the same topics and you don't want to create consumer in each test to poll data. You can create as many consumers in the Test setup as you want and then in test just read data with `Get Messages From Thread` keyword. - ``topics`` (list): List of topics for subscription. - ``group_id`` (str or uuid.uuid4() if not set) : name of the consumer group to join for dynamic partition assignment (if enabled), and to use for fetching and committing offsets. If None, unique string is generated (via uuid.uuid4()) and offset commits are disabled. Default: `None`.

kw.name: Set Suite Variable
kw.doc: Makes a variable available everywhere within the scope of the current suite.

kw.name: Create Producer
kw.doc: Create Kafka Producer and returns its `group_id` as string. If `schema_registry_url` is used, Kafka Producer client which does avro schema encoding to messages is created instead.

kw.name: Set Suite Variable
kw.doc: Makes a variable available everywhere within the scope of the current suite.

kw.name: Set Suite Variable
kw.doc: Makes a variable available everywhere within the scope of the current suite.

kw.name: Produce
kw.doc: Produce message to topic asynchronously to Kafka by encoding with specified or default avro schema.

kw.name: Wait Until Keyword Succeeds
kw.doc: Runs the specified keyword and retries if it fails.

kw.name: Flush
kw.doc: Wait for all messages in the Producer queue to be delivered. Returns the number of messages still in queue. This is a convenience method that calls poll() until len() is zero or the optional timeout elapses. - `timeout` (real) : Optional timeout. Default: `0.1`.

kw.name: Log
kw.doc: Logs the given message with the given level.

kw.name: Should Be Equal As Integers
kw.doc: Fails if objects are unequal after converting them to integers.

kw.name: Sleep
kw.doc: Pauses the test executed for the given time.

kw.name: List Topics
kw.doc: Request Metadata from cluster. Could be executed with consumer or producer group_id too. - ``topic`` (str): If specified, only request info about this topic, else return for all topics in cluster. Default: `None`. - ``group_id`` (str): *required* id of the created consumer or producer.

kw.name: Get Topic Partitions
kw.doc: Returns dictionary of all TopicPartitons in topic (topic.partitions).

kw.doc: Returns the given values which can then be assigned to a variables.

kw.name: Subscribe Topic
kw.doc: Subscribe to a list of topics, or a topic regex pattern. https://docs.confluent.io/current/clients/confluent-kafka-python/#confluent_kafka.Consumer.subscribe

kw.name: Poll
kw.doc: Fetch and return messages from assigned topics / partitions as list. - ``timeout`` (int): Seconds spent waiting in poll if data is not available in the buffer.

Default: None.

kw.name: Get Messages From Thread
kw.doc: Returns all records gathered from specific thread - ``running_thread`` (Thread object) - thread which was executed with `Start Consumer Threaded` keyword - ``decode_format`` (str) - If you need to decode data to specific format (See https://docs.python.org/3/library/codecs.html#standard-encodings). Default: None.

kw.name: Should Be Equal
kw.doc: Fails if the given objects are unequal.

kw.doc: Fails if the given objects are unequal.

kw.name: Clear Messages From Thread
kw.doc: Remove all records gathered from specific thread - ``running_thread`` (Thread object) - thread which was executed with `Start Consumer Threaded` keyword

kw.name: Create Producer
kw.doc: Create Kafka Producer and returns its `group_id` as string. If `schema_registry_url` is used, Kafka Producer client which does avro schema encoding to messages is created instead.

kw.name: Produce
kw.doc: Produce message to topic asynchronously to Kafka by encoding with specified or default avro schema.

kw.name: Produce
kw.doc: Produce message to topic asynchronously to Kafka by encoding with specified or default avro schema.

kw.name: Flush
kw.doc: Wait for all messages in the Producer queue to be delivered. Returns the number of messages still in queue. This is a convenience method that calls poll() until len() is zero or the optional timeout elapses. - `timeout` (real) : Optional timeout. Default: `0.1`.

kw.name: Should Be Equal As Integers
kw.doc: Fails if objects are unequal after converting them to integers.

kw.name: New Topic
kw.doc: Instantiate a NewTopic object. Specifies per-topic settings for passing to AdminClient.create_topics(). - ``topic`` (str): Topic name Note: In a multi-cluster production scenario, it is more typical to use a replication_factor of 3 for durability.

kw.doc: Adds ``values`` to the end of ``list``.

kw.name: Create Topics
kw.doc: Create one or more new topics and wait for each one to finish. - ``new_topics`` (list(NewTopic) or NewTopic): A list of specifications (NewTopic) or a single instance for the topics that should be created.
kw.msg: Topic admintesting1 created Topic admintesting2 created Topic admintesting3 created

kw.name: Create Consumer
kw.doc: Create Kafka Consumer and returns its `group_id` as string.

kw.name: List Topics
kw.doc: Request Metadata from cluster. Could be executed with consumer or producer group_id too. - ``topic`` (str): If specified, only request info about this topic, else return for all topics in cluster. Default: `None`. - ``group_id`` (str): *required* id of the created consumer or producer.

kw.name: New Partitions

kw.name: Create Partitions
kw.doc: Create additional partitions for the given topics. - ``new_partitions`` (list(NewPartitions) or NewPartitions): New partitions to be created.
kw.msg: Additional partitions created for topic admin_testing_partition

kw.name: Config Resource
kw.doc: Represents a resource that has configuration, and (optionally) a collection of configuration properties for that resource. Used by describe_configs() and alter_configs(). - ``restype`` (ConfigResource.Type): The resource type. - ``name`` (str): The resource name, which depends on the resource type. For RESOURCE_BROKER, the resource name is the broker id.

kw.name: Describe Configs
kw.doc: Get the configuration of the specified resources. - ``resources`` (list(ConfigResource) or ConfigResource): Resources to get the configuration for.

kw.name: Should Not Be Empty
kw.doc: Verifies that the given item is not empty.

kw.doc: Returns the given values which can then be assigned to a variables.

kw.doc: Fails if objects are unequal after converting them to strings.

kw.doc: Fails if objects are unequal after converting them to integers.

kw.name: Create Dictionary
kw.doc: Creates and returns a dictionary based on the given ``items``.

kw.name: Convert To Dictionary
kw.doc: Converts the given ``item`` to a Python ``dict`` type.

kw.name: Config Resource
kw.doc: Represents a resource that has configuration, and (optionally) a collection of configuration properties for that resource. Used by describe_configs() and alter_configs(). - ``restype`` (ConfigResource.Type): The resource type. - ``name`` (str): The resource name, which depends on the resource type. For RESOURCE_BROKER, the resource name is the broker id.

kw.name: Alter Configs
kw.doc: Update configuration properties for the specified resources. - ``resources`` (list(ConfigResource) or ConfigResource): Resources to update configuration of.

kw.doc: Pauses the test executed for the given time.

kw.name: Start Consumer Threaded
kw.doc: Run consumer in daemon thread and store data from topics. To read and work with this collected data use keyword `Get Messages From Thread`. Could be used at the Test setup or in each test. This is useful when you are reading always the same topics and you don't want to create consumer in each test to poll data. You can create as many consumers in the Test setup as you want and then in test just read data with `Get Messages From Thread` keyword. - ``topics`` (list): List of topics for subscription. - ``group_id`` (str or uuid.uuid4() if not set) : name of the consumer group to join for dynamic partition assignment (if enabled), and to use for fetching and committing offsets. If None, unique string is generated (via uuid.uuid4()) and offset commits are disabled. Default: `None`.

kw.name: Set Suite Variable
kw.doc: Makes a variable available everywhere within the scope of the current suite.

test.name: Example Oauth

kw.name: Skip
kw.doc: Skips the rest of the current test.

kw.name: Create Producer
kw.doc: Create Kafka Producer and returns its `group_id` as string. If `schema_registry_url` is used, Kafka Producer client which does avro schema encoding to messages is created instead.

test.doc: Example of how to use OAUTH with library and call functools via get_token function. For better handling there could be some global variable which can be set inside of python lib. Not executable right now, needs update env (issue #21).
